intro: Psychotria cephalophora, commonly known as the "Crown of the Forest," is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white, tubular flowers. It produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Psychotria cephalophora is also notable for its role in traditional medicine and its ecological significance in forest ecosystems.
